medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started suddenly 20 hours prior to presentation at 11pm. It is epigastric and in both lower quadrants, worsening over time. The patient experienced nausea that improved after eating a small meal at 1pm. He reports subjective fevers and chills and denies any diarrhea, constipation, or blood in stools. This episode is noted to be different from a similar episode a month ago, as that pain resolved the next day.
